fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29875].
  {panel}

It would be useful to import users and/or directories from other applications, such as Confluence.

This would facilitate situations like:

# Switching from JIRA to Crowd or vice versa
# A company has Confluence already, gets JIRA, and wants to move the users from Confluence into JIRA so they can use JIRA to manage the users in Confluence
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to import/export users and/or directories from/to other applications
A build-in notification system and a history log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29873].
  {panel}

The following features are available in the Adobe-Flash based Workflow Designer, but not the Text-Based Workflow Editor.

# The ability to clone an existing transition
# The ability to use a common transition
# -The ability to use global transitions- JRA-29117
# -You cannot see the Create Issue step and transition and therefore cannot edit the transition (adding validation or post functions)- JRA-6719
fields.summary: Text Workflow Editor is missing features available in Workflow Designer
In-App Notifications inside JIRA
Add ability to sort labels in the alphabatical order
JIRA administrator able to add dashboard owner more than one JIRA User
CSV Import only saves the first attribute value for a Multi-User-Picker custom field
As a JIRA user, I would like notifications generated by other users making multiple in-line edit changes over a short period of time to be delivered to me in a single notification
As an admin of a Webhooks client I would like JIRA to queue messages to clients in the event that the client cannot be reached
Strip trailing spaces from custom field names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29851].
  {panel}

The "*View Version Control*" permission in the Permission Schemes in JIRA seems to have been renamed to "*View Issue Source Tab*" in JIRA 5.1 and 5.2. Could we reflect this change in our documentation for the latest versions such as the 'Integrating JIRA with FishEye' doc: https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/bg_mEQ
\\
\\
|h4. JIRA 5.0:
!Edit Permissions - JIRA 5.0.7.png|align=left! |h4. JIRA 5.2:
!Edit Permissions - JIRA 5.2.png|align=right! |
fields.summary: Update documentation regarding 'View Version Control' permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29849].
  {panel}

If you use any saved search that uses more than 3 ORDER BY criteria, the "JIRA filter results" gadget will ignore everything beyond the first 3 inputs.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a basic search using 4 search criteria (ex: due date, fixVersion, priority, severity)
2) Add a Filter Results Gadget to Dashboard
3) Compare ordering results between the Issue Navigator and the Dashboard gadget
4) Observe the dashboard gadget appears to not work for more than 3 ordering criteria
fields.summary: Filter Results Gadget does not respect more than 3 ORDER BY inputs
JIRA Cloud text gadget
Releasing a point release milestone stops the downgrade from working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29839].
  {panel}

Currently, the *Activity Stream* in *JIRA* only supports the following:
# Project
# JIRA Issue Key
# Update Date
# Username
# Activity
# Issue Type

!activity_stream_filter.JPG!

It will be better if there is a function whereby you are able to use custom JQL to filter out the *Activity Stream*.
fields.summary: Filtering Activity Stream using custom JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29834].
  {panel}

Please update the [Jelly Tags|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Jelly+Tags] documentation so that {{schedule}} in {{jira:AddVersion}} is clearer. Currently it only explains that it is the "Schedule of the version.", however we have no further info on how it works.

Thanks!

h3. Workarounds

# Use the [CLI|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.jira.cli].
# Use SOAP or REST directly.
fields.summary: Jelly jira:AddVersion schedule is not clearly explained

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29823].
  {panel}

We have a need to see how long a scoop of issues have been in different states, f.ex.:

A scope of 100 issues have been in Created: 35m (Average) Hi:4h Lo:2m
A scope of 100 issues have been in Open: 65h (Average) Hi:71h Lo:14m
A scope of 100 issues have been in In Progress: 72h (Average) Hi:102h Lo:58m
A scope of 100 issues have been in Resolved: 40h (Average) Hi:112h Lo:16h

This scoop could include issues in one or more projects.

It should be possible to get a nice report printed of these figures.

( In the Jira suite plugin you get this info per issue, so you are half-way there already :) )
fields.summary: Lead time to enable reports containing time spent in status for a scoop of issues
Can't resolve/close tickets
getWorkLog api gives an error when i am trying to cal getWoklog API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29820].
  {panel}

JIRA 5.1.4
View a comment
Use the Activity display mode, next to All, Comments, Work Log, and History.
Read more link can appear in 2 places.

1 is inside of a comment which is cut off and appears inside of the blue box where the comment text exists. Click on this link would take you to the top of the issue. This seems kind of useless and misleading.

2 is if the description of the issue is too long when it is created or edited, you can get the same thing as you showed in your screenshot. Clicking on this will also take you to the top of the current issue. This also seems pretty useless and misleading.

If the link is for a comment, it should take you to the comment. If the link is for an action, it should take you to that in the All tab.
fields.summary: "Read more" link in Activity stream in an issue should redirect to correct place

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29809].
  {panel}

+Components:+
# When renaming a *Component* within a project, it automatically applies to all created issues
# However, it is not applied to saved filters. When filters contains *Component* condition, then rename of a component should be applied to those saved JQLs too.

Of course, you can manually go over all saved filters and modify component condition.

+Status:+
# Renaming the *Status* is not applied to saved filters.
# This is happening when changes are made in either of the followings:
#* Active workflow edit of status in Workflows > Diagram tab > Status Editor
#* Issue Attributes > Statuses
# To replicate:
#* Create a save filter with Status for example “Open” and use it in the Filter Results gadget
#* Rename the status “Open” to “Open123”
#* The Filter Results gadget will return error as below
{noformat}
The selected filter filter-10000 has an error: The value 'Open' does not exist for the field 'status'..
{noformat}

JIRA should not allow any renaming of the Status being made or maybe a warning should be shown. Better yet, the saved filter should be able to update itself accordingly.
fields.summary: Renaming of Components and Status is not reflected in Saved Filter JQL

fields.description:

Steps to reproduce:
# Visit EACJ
# Type INTSYS into the search field to query all INTSYS issues
# Click "More Criteria" and add "Department"
# Click the new dropdown that has appeared

Expected results:
The list should be sorted alphabetically

Actual results:
No particular ordering is apparent and there is no way to search or filter this drop-down. This means a manual scan of the results is necessary to find the value I want.
fields.summary: Custom fields dropdown not sorted in new issue navigator
Highlight admin only functions in the UI

fields.description:
Dear JIRA Support,

We have problem when our JIRA incoming mail server tries to forward some emails to other email account. The exception is :


An error was encountered whilst handling messages from the mail server "JTEL" using the handler "class com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler".

The error was:
------------------------
"Message appears to have been sent by JIRA. JIRA's mail handler is configured to forward these messages to avoid mail loops."
------------------------

An issue is created right when an email is fetched by JIRA, but on the forwarded email account, we always get an email with the before message. We have had a look at the log files, but there isn't any exception. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Error forwarding email - incoming mail server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29786].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in JIRA's SOAP API that allows an attacker who has a valid JIRA account to overwrite any files that are writeable by the OS user JIRA runs under. This may result in the attacker being able to execute arbitrary Java code in the context of JIRA server.

All versions of JIRA up to and including 5.1.4 are affected by this vulnerability. The vulnerability is fixed in JIRA 5.1.5 and later

For more details see advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2013-02-21

Patches

||Version ||File ||
|5.0.7|[patch-JRA-29786-5.0.7.zip|		http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/patch-JRA-29786-5.0.7.zip] |
|5.1.4|[patch-JRA-29786-5.1.4.zip|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/patch-JRA-29786-5.1.4.zip] |
fields.summary: File overwrite via SOAP API
JIRA Installer should set the correct collation on table creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29755].
  {panel}

The current JIRA configuration tool generates old-style Oracle JDBC URLs that specify a SID. This can be problematic for two reasons:

# High-availability clusters can only be connected to using the service name using a newer URL syntax
# The Oracle documentation says that the old syntax is no longer supported as of 10g

Please update the configuration tool to generate the service name type URLs. Right now customers like us who are using HA configurations are forced to edit dbconfig.xml by hand.

More info:
http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/java.112/e16548/urls.htm#BEIDHCBA
http://www.orafaq.com/wiki/JDBC#Thin_driver
fields.summary: Configuration tool should generate thin-style service name Oracle JDBC URLs
Option to change "User email visibility" to Hidden does not hide email address when adding, or changing assignee in issues.
Images' description appears the same in the modal panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29749].
  {panel}

Currently it is not possible for the JIRA issue collector to create issues with 'Anonymous' reporter.

To reproduce:
* Set JIRA to allow Group (Anyone) to create issues within your project
* Set the Field configuration, setting the *Reporter* field to be optional
* Create a new Issue Collector
* Notice the red asterick( * ) that still indicates the *Issue Reporter* field being required
* Leaving the field blank and trying to proceed with the creation results in error:
{code}Please enter default reporter create issues in project.{code}

Note: users can still anonymously create issues via Issue Collector, but the result is that the Reporter is still to a defined default user.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Collector does not allow for the Reporter field being 'Anonymous'
Make the List Box and Combo Box controls on the Issue Navigator resizeable
Update JIRA images for retina display quality
Notification emails should contain more information about issues
As a user, I would like to be able to use a wildcard on fields like components, versions, assignees, etc

fields.description:
Several of our JIRA users are receiving the same notification over and over-- approximately 10 duplicates.  Not all users are seeing these duplicates, but enough that this does not appear to be an isolated incident.

When I check the Mail Queue, several emails are highlighted in red.  Several emails have logged in the Error Queue as well, and I've tried deleting them to see if the duplicates will discontinue, but the emails are sending again.  I've tried resending, flushing, and bypassing.  I thought I had the queue cleared out earlier today, but the issue arose again.  We've seen this issue for over 24 hours now.

If the issue arises again, I will add screen shots.
fields.summary: Email notifications duplicating for individual notification

fields.description:
I am seeing a ton of the following errors

2012-09-13 14:10:00,103 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [core.entity.transaction.JNDIFactory] NamingException while finding UserTransaction name
d java:comp/env/UserTransaction in JNDI.
javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: Name [UserTransaction] is not bound in this Context. Unable to find [UserTransaction].
        at org.apache.naming.NamingContext.lookup(NamingContext.java:820)
        at org.apache.naming.NamingContext.lookup(NamingContext.java:154)

------------------
# less /opt/tomcat/jira/conf/Catalina/localhost/jira.xml
<!--
A sample configuration file for Tomcat 4.1.x and 5.0
Customize the docBase attribute, drop in your $CATALINA_HOME/webapps/ (4.1.x) or
$CATALINA_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ (5.0) directory and restart Tomcat.
Note the JOTM dependencies; you'll need to copy various jars to Tomcat's common/lib/ directory.
See http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/servers/tomcat41.html for details.
-->

<Context path="/jira" docBase="webapps/atlassian-jira-5.1.4.war" debug="0" useHttpOnly="true">

 <Resource name="UserTransaction" auth="Container" type="javax.transaction.UserTransaction"/>
  <ResourceParams name="UserTransaction">
    <parameter>
      <name>factory</name>
      <value>org.objectweb.jotm.UserTransactionFactory</value>
    </parameter>
    <parameter>
      <name>jotm.timeout</name>
      <value>60</value>
    </parameter>
  </ResourceParams>
</Context>
-------------------

snippet for entityengine.xml

<!-- TRANSACTION FACTORY - This configures how JIRA finds the application server's transaction management.
    The default ('java:comp/env/UserTransaction') is correct for Tomcat 5.5. For details on configuring for other
    application servers - see:
        http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/entityengine.html#transactionfactory
    -->
    <transaction-factory class="org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.JNDIFactory">
      <user-transaction-jndi jndi-server-name="default" jndi-name="java:comp/env/UserTransaction"/>
      <transaction-manager-jndi jndi-server-name="default" jndi-name="java:comp/env/UserTransaction"/>
    </transaction-factory>
fields.summary: "Failed to find UserTransaction" errors in catalina.out

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29701].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to reproduce : 
 * Create a dashboard 
 * Share the dashboard with a specific group that you are one of there member. 
 * Login as Administrator, remove the user that shared the dashboard from the group they share it with. 
 * User will be able to see his dashboard but can't edit it. 

h5.Expected : 
 * User still be able to edit his dashboard since they are the owner of the dashboard.
fields.summary: When you remove the user from the group that shared the dashboard with, user will not be able to edit their own dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29700].
  {panel}

*Scenario of the issue*
# The *Original Estimate* of an issue is set to *1d*
# User accidentally log work with the value of *0,25h*. Hence the work log is automatically takes the *Time Spent* as *3d 1h* and the *Remaining Estimate* is automatically set to *0*
# Hence, the user edits the work log from the *Work Log* tab and adjust the *Time Spent* again to correct *0.25h* and in addition to that, *Remaining Estimate* is set again to *1d*
# Sometimes the customer might forget the original value of *Original Estimate*. The workaround is to check on the *History* tab for the original value.


Some improvements that can be made include:
- Perform check for invalid characters and values such as *0,25h*
- Introduce a button to grab the *Original Estimate* that is entered in the beginning rather than checking through the *History* tab
fields.summary: Work Log auto correction of Remaining Estimate and error checking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29699].
  {panel}

Hi,

I thought I'd suggest this new feature to you.

Often, at least for us, there are several releases to an internal test environment before it finally reaches production. Our customers are not very keen on browsing several release notes, when all they know is that their system was just upgraded from v1.1 to v1.2.5. They only want to read up on the delta change, which in this case would be a compilation of release 1.2, 1.2.1, 1.2.2, 1.2.3, 1.2.4 and 1.2.5.

Well... for you to consider!

Cheers,
--peter
fields.summary: As a deployment manager I want to compile release notes to reflect a delta change of an environment

fields.summary: Failure to create a remote issue link between JAC and EAN and vice versa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29676].
  {panel}

See screenshot. The message reads:

Instead we recommend using an external database, for a list of supported databases please see our documentation

It should read:

Instead we recommend using an external database, for a list of supported databases please see our documentation.
fields.summary: Missing period in HSQL DB warning message
Notification scheme links can be confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29673].
  {panel}

h3. Current Situation
The permission 'Browse Project' sets whether or not the user can view the project overview and the issues within. If the user is not granted the 'Browse Project' permission, he/she cannot view both the overview and the issues.

h3. Improvement Request
Add a new project permission that separates viewing the project overview from the issues. This way, a user can view the overview of the project without being able to view the issues
fields.summary: Permission to allow user to view Project Overview but not the Issues
Possibility to have a subtask work chain

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29671].
  {panel}

In JIRA 5.1.x, custom field with long name are getting truncated in the Issue View screen. Looking further at this behavior, it seems that the issue view will only support custom field name up to 20 characters. For the fields name with more than 20 characters, the name will be truncated. 

Kindly refer to the following sample screenshot which reflects the behavior:
!jira51.png! 

It will be great if we can wrap the field name, the way as it is in JIRA 5.0.x:
!jira50.png!
fields.summary: Long custom field names are truncated in the View Issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29669].
  {panel}

It would be great if JIRA kept track of whether a specific issue/comment was created directly via web or via email. I need to understand what channels my customers are using to communicate with me more.

Perhaps this could just be a flag/property of the issue/comment that shows up under the History tab as well?

Of course it should also be accessible via JQL if possible so I can use the standard reporting tools for some initial data mining. I would like to be able to run a query and tell easily that X% of my customers are interacting with me via email, Y% of my customers only use email etc.

In fact, it would be great to have a break down of the volume of the issues/comments that were added using REST API or web interface or email or some other means etc...
fields.summary: Better tracking of the interactions
JIRA Documentation Links on CAC for v3.13 and earlier are Broken
